abstract: Town of Conklin, NY, is representative of challenges facing area of state that runs parallel to Pennsylvania and is known as Southern Tier; area, once manufacturing hub, faces seemingly intractable demographic patterns; while area residents had hoped prosperity would come from local casino or hydraulic fracturing boom, state government stymied those plans.
lead_paragraph: The region was once a manufacturing powerhouse, but residents, doubting the state’s commitment to it, now refer to the area as the “Forgotten Tier.”

headline.main: New York’s Southern Tier, Once a Home for Big Business, Is Struggling
headline.print_headline: Former Hub of Manufacturing Ponders Next Act

snippet: The region was once a manufacturing powerhouse, but residents, doubting the state’s commitment to it, now refer to the area as the “Forgotten Tier.”
